chapter.title: Using Designer to build a VDB

sect1.title: Download Designer
sect1.para: Federate Tools project provides a Eclipse based designer tool for this purpose of building a VDB. You can download Designer here Also, follow instructions for the tool as to how to install on your machine. Once done installing, start the Designer

sect1.title: Building a VDB
sect1.para: Once you start the VDB, there are various steps you will need to do in creating the VDB. The below is list of steps that need to be accomplished using the Designer tool. See the video at the end of the list, that takes you though the all the steps involved.

listitem.para: Switch to Designer Prespective, by opening the "Window->Open Prespective.."
Manually create the source model for the "Text File" as there is importer for it. Create a Table called "Price" with "stock" and "price" as column names
In the "AccountView" model, create a virtual table (called as Base Table in the menu), and build the transformation query combining the "Accounts" tables with "Price" table
Create a new VDB, by selecting File->New->Virtual Database Definition
Add the "Accounts View" model to the VDB, then switch to the "execute" tab
Press "execute" and once connected, issue any client query specific to the virtual table created.
Now this VDB is ready to be deployed in the Federate Embedded
